text: John Curtis Ager, Jr. (born 1949) is a Democratic politician from North Carolina. Ager serves in the North Carolina General Assembly, representing the 115th district in the state House of Representatives since 2015. In early 2018 Ager voiced support for background checks, waiting periods, and ending the “gun show loophole.” ==References== Category:Living people Category:North Carolina Democrats Category:21st-century American politicians Category:1949 births Category:Members of the North Carolina House of Representatives
